fact: Your fingers wrinkle in water to improve grip – it's a survival reflex!
Goosebumps are a survival reflex from our hairy ancestors.
Sharks existed before trees.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found edible honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
The heart of a blue whale is so big that a human could crawl through the arteries.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way galaxy.
Your stomach gets an entirely new lining every 3-5 days.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
A single cloud can weigh more than a million pounds.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38-45 minutes.
Dolphins have names for each other.
The human brain uses 20% of the body's total energy.
Lightning strikes the Earth about 100 times per second.
A day on Venus is longer than its year.
Cats can't taste sweetness.
The Great Wall of China isn't visible from space with the naked eye.
Your nose can remember up to 50,000 different scents.
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping so they don't drift apart.
Tom Hanks' brother Jim does most of his voice acting for Toy Story video games and commercials.
The sound of lightsabers in Star Wars was created by combining the hum of old TV sets with film projector motor noise.
Movie theater popcorn costs more per ounce than filet mignon.
In Titanic, the scene where Jack draws Rose was actually James Cameron drawing – they just swapped the hands in post-production.
The word 'set' has the most different meanings in the English language – over 430 distinct definitions.
Bubble wrap was originally invented as wallpaper.
The smell of rain has a name: petrichor.
In movies, when actors eat food, they usually spit it out between takes to avoid getting sick.
The 'ringing' sound you hear in absolute silence is called tinnitus, and it's actually your brain creating noise.
Movie blood is usually made from corn syrup, food coloring, and chocolate syrup.
The plastic tips at the end of shoelaces are called aglets.
A group of ravens is called an 'unkindness' and a group of owls is called a 'parliament'.
Most movie 'glass' that actors break through is actually made of sugar or resin.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins.
There’s enough DNA in the human body to stretch from the sun to Pluto and back — 17 times.
The Eiffel Tower can grow up to 6 inches during summer due to heat expansion.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped to prevent it from rolling away.
There is a species of jellyfish that is biologically immortal.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time in a process called 'triple point'.
Giraffes only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep a day.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
The moon has moonquakes, similar to earthquakes on Earth.
Some metals are so reactive that they explode on contact with water.
There's a basketball court on the top floor of the U.S. Supreme Court building, nicknamed 'the highest court in the land'.
Mantis shrimps can punch with the speed of a bullet.
The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one.
Hot water can freeze faster than cold water — this is known as the Mpemba effect.
Cleopatra lived closer to the invention of the iPhone than to the building of the Great Pyramid.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the observable universe.
Some turtles can breathe through their butts during hibernation.
The cornea is the only part of the human body that has no blood supply and gets oxygen directly from the air.
A single human cell's DNA could fill a million-page book.
Butterflies taste with their feet, allowing them to decide where to lay their eggs.
The human brain generates about 12-25 watts of electricity, enough to power a low-wattage LED light.
Lungs are the only organs in the human body that can float on water.
Some animals, like birds and bacteria, can detect magnetic fields for navigation.
The tongue is the fastest healing part of the human body.
The skin wrinkling in water is an active neurological response that improves grip by channeling water away like tire treads.
Laughing when tickled is actually an expression of fear by your brain signalling something crawling on you.
Venomous animals inject venom, whereas poisonous animals are harmful to touch or eat.
Sharks have been around for over 400 million years, predating dinosaurs.
Jellyfish have been in the oceans for more than 500 million years.
The human body contains about 37.2 trillion cells.
The largest living structure on Earth is the Great Barrier Reef.
Some fungi can create networks that span miles underground.
Saturn is the least dense planet in our solar system; it could float in water.
The strongest muscle in the human body relative to its size is the masseter (jaw muscle).
The fastest bird is the peregrine falcon, which can reach speeds over 240 mph during a dive.
Elephants can communicate using infrasound, sounds below human hearing range.
The oldest living tree is a bristlecone pine estimated to be over 5,000 years old.
A teaspoon of honey represents the life work of 12 bees.
Lightning is five times hotter than the surface of the sun.
Neutron stars are so dense that a sugar-cube-sized amount of their material would weigh about 100 million tons.
Octopuses have the ability to edit their RNA, allowing rapid adaptation.
The human heart beats over 3 billion times in an average lifetime.
Saturn's rings are made mostly of ice chunks ranging in size from dust to mountains.
A sneeze can travel at speeds of over 100 miles per hour.
Butterflies can see ultraviolet light, which is invisible to humans.
Venus rotates clockwise, opposite from most other planets.
Pine trees can communicate with each other using underground fungal networks.
The world's smallest reptile is a chameleon that is smaller than a paperclip.
The Milky Way galaxy is on a collision course with the Andromeda galaxy, expected in about 4 billion years.
A cockroach can live for several weeks without its head.
There are more bacteria in your body than human cells.
Saturn's moon Titan has lakes of liquid methane and ethane.
The fastest insect is the dragonfly, able to fly up to 36 mph.
The planet Neptune was mathematically predicted before it was visually observed.
Slugs have four noses.
Your bones are constantly being broken down and rebuilt, with a completely new skeleton every 10 years.
Ants can carry objects up to 50 times their own body weight.
Fireflies produce their own light through a chemical reaction called bioluminescence.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a giant storm that has lasted at least 400 years.
Polar bear fur is actually transparent and hollow; it just appears white.
The sun accounts for 99.86% of the total mass of our Solar System.
The average person sheds about 600,000 particles of skin every hour.
Some spiders can glide or parachute for distances, using their silk threads.
The first living creatures to go into space were fruit flies.
Venus is the hottest planet in the Solar System with surface temperatures up to 900°F (475°C).
The tongue print of a person is as unique as their fingerprint.
Dinosaurs roamed the Earth for around 165 million years.
The electric eel can produce a shock of up to 600 volts.
A jellyfish’s body is composed of 95% water.
The Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the sun, around 10,800°F (6,000°C).
Crows are known to recognize individual human faces and remember them for years.
Fruit bats navigate by echolocation similar to dolphins.
A day on Mercury lasts about 59 Earth days.
The Eiffel Tower weighs about 10,000 tons.
Bees have five eyes – two large compound eyes and three smaller simple eyes.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
The deepest part of the ocean, the Mariana Trench, is about 36,070 feet deep.
Butterflies taste with sensors on their feet.
The human body has enough fat to produce more than seven bars of soap.
Rats laugh when tickled.
The only letter that doesn't appear on the periodic table is the letter J.
A group of jellyfish is called a bloom, smack, or swarm.
Fingernails grow faster on your dominant hand.
Starfish can regenerate lost arms, and some species can regrow an entirely new starfish from a single arm.
The banana is a herb, not a tree or fruit.
The coldest temperature ever recorded on Earth was -128.6°F (-89.2°C) in Antarctica.
The average human body contains enough sulfur to kill all fleas on an average dog.
The first ever VCR, made in 1956, was the size of a piano.
Napoleon was once attacked by a horde of rabbits.
Dogs' noses are wet to help absorb scent chemicals.
The Great Pyramid was the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.
The hummingbird is the only bird that can fly backwards.
A single bolt of lightning contains enough energy to toast 100,000 slices of bread.
Whales can hold their breath for over an hour.
Water covers 71% of Earth's surface.
The word 'droid' from Star Wars is a trademarked term by Lucasfilm.
The human eye can distinguish about 10 million different colors.
Sharks can detect a drop of blood in 25 gallons (100 liters) of water.
A narwhal's tusk reveals its health and life history.
The shortest commercial flight in the world lasts 57 seconds.
Humans and giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae.
Venus spins so slowly that its day is longer than its year.
The Sahara Desert was once a tropical rainforest.
Kangaroos can't walk backwards.
The largest volcano in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars.
Elephants can hear with their feet.
The world's longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
Humans glow faintly, but the light is 1,000 times weaker than our eyes can perceive.
Some turtles can survive without oxygen for up to an entire year.
The longest eclipse of the sun could last over 7 minutes.
Mosquitoes are attracted to people who have recently eaten bananas.
The speed of sound is slower in water than in air.
The Earth's magnetic poles have flipped many times throughout history.
The average cumulus cloud weighs about 1 million pounds.
Humans share roughly 60% of their DNA with bananas.
The Mariana Trench is home to fish that can survive under immense pressure.
Jupiter has 79 known moons.
Sharks have no bones; their skeletons are made of cartilage.
The oldest known living animal was a clam named Ming, which lived 507 years.
Alaska is the state with the highest percentage of people who walk or bike to work.
A bolt of lightning is five times hotter than the sun's surface.
The average person blinks about 15-20 times per minute.
Oysters can change gender several times during their lives.
A hummingbird's heart can beat up to 1,260 times per minute.
Sound travels faster in steel than in air.
Sloths can rotate their heads almost 270 degrees.
The human body produces about one liter of saliva daily.
The Sahara Desert is expanding at a rate of about 0.8 kilometers per month.
The brain is capable of generating more electrical impulses in a single day than all the world's telephones combined.
Elephants are the only animals that can't jump.
Humans have more than 600 muscles in their body.
Saturn's rings are surprisingly young – only around 100 million years old.
The platypus is one of the few mammals that lay eggs.
Earthquakes can cause the length of a day to change.
Snakes can sense infrared light through special pits on their faces.
The phrase 'raining cats and dogs' originates from 17th century England.
Some fish can walk on land using their fins.
The deadliest earthquake in recorded history was in Shaanxi, China, in 1556.
Pluto was considered the ninth planet until 2006, when it was reclassified as a dwarf planet.
Honeybees communicate by dancing.
The total weight of all ants on Earth is roughly equal to the weight of all humans.
Your brain is sometimes more active during sleep than when you're awake.
Cats can jump up to six times their body length in a single leap.
The world's largest recorded snowflake was 15 inches wide.
Some plants can communicate through the air by releasing chemical signals.
The bones in an adult human body number 206.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins can.
The moon is moving away from Earth at a rate of about 3.8 centimeters per year.
Chameleons change color to communicate and regulate temperature, not just camouflage.
Venomous cone snails can shoot harpoon-like teeth to paralyze prey.
Human saliva contains enzymes that start digesting food before it reaches your stomach.
The Eiffel Tower was initially intended to be dismantled after 20 years.
Some lizards can squirt blood from their eyes as a defense mechanism.
The blood of horseshoe crabs is blue because it uses copper for oxygen transport.
Lightning strikes produce ozone, which is why the air smells fresh after a storm.
The human liver can regenerate itself from as little as 25% tissue.
Bees can recognize human faces.
The world's oldest known animal cave painting is over 40,000 years old.
A hummingbird's wings beat up to 80 times per second.
Some turtles can breathe through their butts during underwater hibernation.
The planet Uranus rotates on its side.
Narwhals’ tusks are actually elongated teeth with sensory capability.
Your bones are stronger than steel by weight.
Starfish have no brain but can still detect light and touch.
The Amazon rainforest produces more than 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Water bears, or tardigrades, can survive extreme temperatures, radiation, and the vacuum of space.
Plants can ‘hear’ insects chewing and respond by producing defensive chemicals.
